resources.string: Begin populating your degree plan by adding semesters and groups.
You can then add courses, which will display their semester color and appear under their assigned group.
There\'s nothing in this group to manage.
Export failed! Could not write to file.
A backup file was found. This backup file will be overwritten. This cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to continue?
A backup file was found. Your current degree plan will be overwritten. This cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to continue?
Your current database will be overwritten. This cannot be undone.
Are you sure that you want to delete this group? Any courses under this group will be hidden. This cannot be undone.
Are you sure that you want to delete this semester? This cannot be undone.
Are you sure that you want to delete this course? This cannot be undone.
Bug reports and feedback are welcome.

Iuvo can save or restore your degree plan by using a backup located on your SD card. Please be sure to have an external (or "internal") SD card installed!

The backup file is named "IuvoDatabase.db" and can be found at "[SD card]/Iuvo". Iuvo will only save to or restore from this file only.

For the geeks that are wondering: Yes, this backup is indeed viewable in any SQLite viewer.
Be sure to take a deep breath first!
\"When did I take that class again?\"

Iuvo allows you to create semesters in order to match your college career path as closely as possible. You can name your semesters anything you want. "Fall 2011", "May Minimester 2012" or "Greatest Semester Ever!" are all fine! 

 In addition, you can pick a color for your semester. Classes assigned to a semester will be displayed in that semester\’s color on your degree plan.

 Tip: If you don’t want your degree plan to look too colorful, you can assign a single color to many semesters to indicate that they are completed, that you really liked those semesters, or for any other reason you want.
Add a semester from the menu at the top. Enter the name, select a color, and then save. Easy peasy.
Delete a semester by swiping left or right. Courses assigned to that semester will have no semester assigned to them.
Re-arrange your semesters by dragging their handles on the right side. This doesn\’t affect anything else, it simply helps organize your semesters.
Edit a semester name or color by tapping on it.
Not all degree plans are the same

Some degree plans will categorize your classes by subject, such as Math, Science, English, etc. Others will categorize them by year: Freshman, Junior, etc. Iuvo allows you to create groups in order to match your degree plan as closely as possible.
Add a group from the menu at the top. Enter the name and then save. Easy peasy.
Delete a group by swiping left or right. Courses assigned to that group will be hidden from your degree plan.
Re-arrange your groups by dragging their handles on the right side. This affects how your groups appear on your degree plan.
Edit a group name by tapping on it.
Are you a student? Because you must have class.
Adding courses to your degree plan is easy. Start off with the name. Call it whatever you want. \"ENGR 123\", \"Calculus II\" or \"[Professor name] sucks!\" are all perfectly acceptable.
Next up are credit hours and grade. Iuvo should cover all of the possible values for U.S. post-secondary courses. If not, then let the developer know so that it can be included in an update.
Some institutions do not include transfer credit in your GPA calculation. If you don’t want Iuvo to include a course in your GPA calculations, just let it know.

Assign group that you created to your course. Your course will appear under that group in your degree plan. Courses that do not have a group assigned to them will be hidden from your degree plan. You can edit your hidden courses in the ‘more’ tab of the home screen.
Finally, assign a semester that you created to your course. Your course will appear in your degree plan while rockin’ that semester’s color.
No creative title this time, just some simple help.
You can manage your courses within a group the same way you manage your groups and semesters.
Delete a course by swiping left or right. That course will no longer appear on your degree plan.
Re-arrange your courses by dragging their handles on the right side. Your courses will appear in the same order within its assigned group on your degree plan.
Edit a course by tapping on it.
